intro: Lepidium intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate cress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a peppery aroma. Lepidium intermedium is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in gardens or wild areas.
